meanings.definition: To create again; to reconstruct or rebuild.
meanings.sent1: She recrated her Lego set after it fell apart.
meanings.sent2: The artist recrated the sculpture from memory.
meanings.sent3: He recrated his sandcastle after the wave destroyed it.
meanings.sent4: The team recrated their winning strategy for the next game.
meanings.sent5: The chef recrated the famous dish with a new twist.

meanings.definition: To pack or crate items for shipping or storage.
meanings.sent1: They recrated the fragile items carefully for the move.
meanings.sent2: The warehouse workers recrated the products for shipment.
meanings.sent3: She recrated the gifts for her friends in colorful boxes.
meanings.sent4: The movers recrated the furniture to protect it during transport.
meanings.sent5: He recrated the antique vase in bubble wrap before storing it.
